intro: Fumana glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular fumana, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Fumana glandulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
